questions.text: Who won Euro 2000?
questions.explanation:
France.

	They beat Italy 2-1 in the final with the winner coming from a golden goal scored by Trezeguet..

questions.text: Who scored the first goal in the final?
questions.explanation:
Delvecchio.

	Del Vecchio scored first for Italy in the 55th minute and they looked like winning, until Sylvain Wiltord equalised in the last minute of normal time.

questions.text: In which stadium was the final held?
questions.explanation:
De Kuip, Rotterdam.

	The De Kuip Stadium is home to Dutch side, Feyenoord.

questions.text: How many goals were scored from the 31 games played during the tournament?
questions.explanation:
85.

	This is a new record for the Championships.

questions.text: Who scored Italy's two goals in the quarter final match against Romania?
questions.explanation:
Totti, Inzaghi.

	Italy won the match 2-0 to eliminate Romania from the tournament, with both of the goals being scored in the first half.

questions.text: Hiddink was the manager of Holland during the tournament. True or False?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Frank Rijkaard was, although he departed as coach after the tournament. Former Barcelona boss, Louis Van Gaal is now currently (May 2001) the Dutch manager.

questions.text: Who scored the only goal in the England v Germany fixture?
questions.explanation:
Shearer.

	England's first win over the German's since 1986 was scored by Alan Shearer who retired from international football after the tournament.

questions.text: Which country received the most red cards during the whole tournament?
questions.explanation:
Yugoslavia.

	3 (Kezman, Stankovic and Mihajlovic)

questions.text: Nils Johan Semb coached which country during the Championships?
questions.explanation:
Norway.

	Semb took over from previous coach Egil Olsen in August 1998.

questions.text: Which three Portugeuse players recieved lengthy suspensions, after arguing over France's golden goal penalty in the semi-finals?
questions.explanation: Xavier, Nuno Gomes, Paulo Bento.

questions.text: Which goalkeeper gave away an easy goal by stepping on the ball?
questions.explanation:
De Wilde.

	He was in goal for Belgium against Sweden in the opening match of the tournament. Fortunately for him, this error didn't cost Belgium the game as they won 2-1.

questions.text: During the group stages, which fixture produced the most goals?
questions.explanation:
Spain v Yugoslavia.

	Spain won 4-3 with two late goals. This game was said by many, to be the best game of the tournament. Spain had to win to progress to the next round.

questions.text: Denmark didn't score throughout the whole tournament. True or False?
questions.explanation:
True.

	They lost to both France and Holland 3-0 and Czech Republic 2-0 in their three group matches.

questions.text: From these four players, which one scored the most goals in Euro 2000?
questions.explanation:
Smicer.

	Smicer of the Czech Republic scored two. Larsson (Sweden), Del Vecchio (Italy) and Figo (Portugal), all scored one.

questions.text: Who scored a hat-trick against Germany during the tournament?
questions.explanation:
Conceicao.

	Conceicao scored them in Portugal's 3-0 win over the German's to add more misery to their poor tournament.

questions.text: Who came runner up in group B of the group stages to book a place in the quarter finals?
questions.explanation:
Turkey.

	Italy came first in the group with Turkey second. The hosts, Belgium and also Sweden were eliminated.

questions.text: This player scored three goals throughout the championships, although his country was eliminated in the group stages. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Zahovic.

	After impressing in the tournament, Zlatko Zahovic is now playing for top European side, Valencia.

questions.text: How many games did Romania win during the tournament?
questions.explanation:
1.

	In the group stages they beat England 3-2, drew with Germany 1-1 and lost to Portugal 1-0. They made it to the quarter finals and were beaten 2-0 by Italy.

questions.text: Which two players missed the two penalties during open play, for Holland in the semi-final?
options: Ronald De Boer, Frank De Boer
questions.explanation:
Frank De Boer, Patrick Kluivert.

	The game ended 0-0 after extra time, so the tie was decided on penalties. Italy won, with Holland missing three more penalties. Frank De Boer yet again missed his kick.

questions.text: Who scored Germany's only goal throughout the tournament?
questions.explanation:
Scholl.

	Mehmet Scholl scored in the 1-1 draw with Romania.
